comment: A move designed to take advantage of White's passive opening.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d3 d5 3. Nd2 e5 4. exd5
comment: After this exchange it is difficult for White to "harass" the Queen on d5.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d3 d5 3. Nd2 e5 4. exd5 Qxd5 5. Qe2 Nc6 6. Ngf3 f5 7. c3 Nf6 8. Nb3 Be7 9. Nfd2
comment: This is too passive. 9.d4 or 9.c4 would be more promising.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d3 d5 3. Nd2 e5 4. exd5 Qxd5 5. Qe2 Nc6 6. Ngf3 f5 7. c3 Nf6 8. Nb3 Be7 9. Nfd2 O-O 10. Nc4 f4 11. d4 exd4 12. Nxd4 Nxd4 13. cxd4 Bb4+ 14. Bd2 Re8 15. Ne5 Qxd4 16. Qc4+ Qxc4 17. Bxc4+ Be6 18. Bxe6+ Rxe6 19. Bxb4 Rxe5+ 20. Kf1
comment:
Obviously Queenside
castling would have prevented this move which "underdevelops" White's game.

moves: 1. e4 e6 2. d3 d5 3. Nd2 e5 4. exd5 Qxd5 5. Qe2 Nc6 6. Ngf3 f5 7. c3 Nf6 8. Nb3 Be7 9. Nfd2 O-O 10. Nc4 f4 11. d4 exd4 12. Nxd4 Nxd4 13. cxd4 Bb4+ 14. Bd2 Re8 15. Ne5 Qxd4 16. Qc4+ Qxc4 17. Bxc4+ Be6 18. Bxe6+ Rxe6 19. Bxb4 Rxe5+ 20. Kf1 Rae8 21. f3 Re2 22. Bc3 Nd5 23. Bd4 Rd2 24. Bxa7 b6 25. h3 Ne3+ 26. Ke1 Rxb2 27. Rc1 Rxa2 28. Rg1 Rxa7 29. Kd2 c5 30. g3 fxg3 31. Rxg3 Rd7+ 32. Kc3 Kf7 33. Kb3 Nf5 34. Rgg1 Nd4+
comment:
The main merit
of this game is Black's third move ...e5. It is a rare move which looks
promising for Black.
